div.div: The University of Minnesota uses Canvas as its primary learning management system.
Kaltura is a media management platform for teaching, learning, and outreach.
Kaltura capture allows the user to upload previously recorded media. Using the upload feature is recommended for sharing previously recorded media to Canvas.
There are several publishing options that control who can access published Kaltura media.
The Kaltura media space is able to record new content for My Media using user web cams.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.div: Canvas is a web-based learning management system used by learning institutions, educators, and students to access and manage online course learning materials. The University of Minnesota uses Canvas as its primary learning management system.
div.p: Canvas includes a variety of customizable tools to help manage and communicate course content. Kaltura integration with Canvas allows users to upload, record, and edit videos that will later be uploaded to the Canvas course page.
div.div:
Videos in Canvas are often used to share educational content such as
lectures,
demonstrations,
instructions,
weekly overviews.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Kaltura is a media management platform for teaching, learning, and outreach.

This cloud-based system automatically optimizes video files for viewing on any device, includes strong accessibility work flows, powerful search functions, and deep analytics about who is watching videos and for how long.
Kaltura capture allows the user to upload previously recorded media. Using the upload feature is recommended for sharing previously recorded media to Canvas.

li.span: Select the + Add Newbutton in the upper-right corner of the page
Select Upload New Media to make the upload media window appear
Drag and drop your file into the display box or select + Choose a File Upload to button to browse files on your computer
Update the Name, Description, Tags, and Publishing Schedule as desired
Choose your video share settings (on page )
Select Saveat the bottom of the page

div.div: Attention: Your file may take some time to process depending on the size and quality chosen, but it is available in My Media once fully uploaded.

div.p: There are several publishing options that control who can access published Kaltura media.

th.class: - topic/entry entry align-center colsep-0 rowsep-0 valign-top

ul.li: Media page is visible to the content owner only
Media page cannot be shared with others
Media page is visible to anyone with a link to the page
Link must be shared directly with others by Getting a Shareable Link
Media page is visible to individuals according to permissions set for your channels
AChannel must already exist within MediaSpace to use this option

div.p: The Kaltura media space is able to record new content for My Media using user web cams.
div.section: These steps assume your browser can support the WebRTC standard.

li.span: Click the + Add New button found on the top right corner of the page's banner
Select Record Webcam in Browser from the drop-down menu to open the Record Media window

ul.li: The web browser and/or operating system may ask permission for canvas.umn.edu to use your camera and microphone. Click Allow to give Kaltura access to your webcam.
Click the gear icon in the top right corner of the video display to change which/whether camera or microphone is recorded.

div.div: Note: It may take a moment for the camera to appear on screen

li.span: Select the red circle button to start recording

div.div: Important: Scroll to the bottom of the screen if the red button is not visible

li.span: Select the white squar ebutton to stop recording
Select the white play button to review your recording. If you are unsatisfied, click the Record Again button to re-record.
Click Use this to upload the recording to Kaltura
Enter a name for the recording near the bottom of the window
Scroll down, select Save and wait until the window reloads with the message Your changes have been saved
Select Go to Media Page and then Go to My Media to return to your MediaSpace dashboard.
